humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there is 1 out of 23 lymph nodes positive for metastatic carcinoma. Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the number of lymph nodes involved and the size of the metastasis. In this report, it is stated that '1 OF 23 LYMPH NODES POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC CARCINOMA. (1/23) . LARGEST METASTATIC FOCUS: 1.4 CM' Therefore, the patient has 1 positive lymph node out of 23 examined, with the largest metastatic focus being 1.4 cm. This corresponds to an N1 stage.
